They were not visited by anybody

wiki.keyword.forged: A player who is forged had their will and role changed by the forger on their grave.
wiki.keyword.fullMoon: Every night is a full moon night except night one and night three. The Werewolf has a different ability depending on weather or not it is a full moon night.
wiki.keyword.vision: Visions are the investigative result that a Psychic recieves. Good visions show a list of two players that contains at least one townie. Evil visions show a list of three players that contains at least one non-townie.
wiki.keyword.visit:
When you target someone, you will usually visit them. Visits are what actually causes active abilities to work. For example: A Sheriff could target a player, but a Witch could cause them to visit someone else, and then the Sheriff will get their results about the other player.

Targeting is who you choose to use your ability on and visiting is who it actually happens on. The witch and transporter change who you visit and therefore change who your ability works one

Visits can have properties such as astral or attacking.
wiki.keyword.convert: A player's role changes during the game. All of their ability uses are refilled to maximum. For Example: If someone is converted to a Veteran, they get all three alerts.
wiki.keyword.roleblock: A player who is roleblocked had their visits erased. A player's visits being erased often means they can't use their ability. Some players are immune to being roleblocked. Escorts and Consorts can roleblock people.
wiki.keyword.jail: A Jailor can put a player in jail. If they are in jail, they can talk with the Jailor at night, the Jailor can decide to execute them or not, they can't target anyone, and most abilities visiting them will fail.
wiki.keyword.rampage: When all the visitors to a player are attacked by some ability. The player with the ability won't necessarily visit the players being attacked by the rampage.
wiki.keyword.possess: A player who is possessed had their visits changed by the Witch, Necromancer, or Retributionist.
wiki.keyword.defense:
Attack powers are Basic, Powerful, and Unstoppable.

Defense powers are Basic, Powerful, and Invincible.

Some roles have defense by default. Defense can be granted to players through abilities like the Doctor's Ability. Attacks can only overpower defense that is at least one level lower. So a Powerful attack can kill a player with Basic defense, but can't kill a player with Powerful defense. A player with invincible defense can only die by getting lynched or leaving the game.
wiki.keyword.protect: Usually this means increasing someone's defense for a night, but It could mean many things depending who is protecting who.
wiki.keyword.dead: If a player is dead, they can't vote, their grave will likely be in the graveyard, and they usually can't use their ability anymore. Dead players can only speak with other dead players with the exception of the medium. A player needs to die to become dead. All players start not dead. What did you expect‚Ä¶
wiki.keyword.silenced: A player who is silenced can not talk during that day, and can not vote for players during the voting phase. They can still vote during the judgment phase. If the silenced player is put on trial, they still can't talk. If the players are talking out loud, silenced players should not speak or use any type of communication. Not even signals or facial expressions. If a player can't use chat, they can't communicate.
wiki.keyword.friends: A Seer's result which indicates that the two players they visited can win together.
wiki.keyword.enemies: A Seer's result which indicates that the two players they visited can not win together.
wiki.keyword.alert: A Veterans ability. If you visit a veteran while they are on alert, they will deal a powerful attack to you. A Veteran can up to Alert three times.
wiki.keyword.haunt: After they die, a Medium can haunt a living player to talk to them during the night. Every dead medium will be in the haunt chat with every haunted player.
wiki.keyword.transport: Two players who are transported with each other will have all of their visitors swapped. So if a Sheriff goes to visit a player who's transported with another player, then the sheriff will actually visit the other player.
wiki.keyword.innocent: A result the Sheriff can get usually indicating the person they visited is good.
wiki.keyword.suspicious: A result the Sheriff can get usually indicating the person they visited is evil.
wiki.keyword.guilty: Voting for someone to be lynched during a Judgement phase. If there are more Guilty votes, the player on trial is lynched.
wiki.keyword.abstain: Not voting during a Judgment phase. If all players Abstain, then the player on trial is not lynched.
wiki.keyword.cleaned: A player who is cleaned had their role and will be erased from the graveyard. A Janitor can clean people on the night that they die to erase someone's role and will from the graveyard.
wiki.keyword.evil: Has many meanings, Usually means a role is non-town.
wiki.keyword.roleLimit: The maximum number of that role that can be generated at the start of a regular game. If there is no limit, then there can be infinite.
wiki.keyword.doused: Someone's house is doused in gasoline. Arsonists can douse peoples houses, and ignite them. Doused players have a Suspicious Aura.
wiki.keyword.backup: The Godfather can choose another mafia member to be their backup at any time. If the Godfather is Roleblocked or Jailed, then the Backup will attempt to kill their target.
wiki.keyword.suspiciousAura: Players with a Suspicious Aura look evil to investigative roles. The Sheriff will find them suspicious, the Seer will find them as enemies with everyone, and the Psychic could see them in their evil visions. If a player has both an innocent and suspicious aura, the suspicious aura takes priority.
wiki.keyword.innocentAura: Players with an Innocent Aura look innocent to investigative roles. The Sheriff will find them innocent, the Seer will find them friends with everyone, and the Psychic could see them in their good visions. If a player has both an innocent and suspicious aura, the suspicious aura takes priority.
wiki.keyword.appearedVisit:
A player could _appear_ to have visited someone, even though they didn't. This is usually caused by evil roles such as Framer.

This only affects investigative roles.

_Examples_

The Tracker can see the appeared visit, but not the real visit.

A Veteran wont kill a player who appeared to visit them and didn't actually visit them.
wiki.keyword.astral: If a Visit is astral that means it is undetected by most roles. Lookouts and Trackers won't see an astral visit. The Veteran won't kill someone who visited with an astral visit, However the Transporter will still transport astral visits.
wiki.keyword.roleOutline:
An element of the role list (More appropriately titled the role outline list). It defines a set of roles that could possibly fill a slot on the list.

Outlines can be one of these types, any, faction, faction and alignment, or exact. Each defining a set of roles based on different parameters.

_Examples_

"Any" It could be any role

"Town Any" Could be any possible town role.

"Neutral Evil" Could be any role with the faction neutral and alignment evil such as the Jester and executioner

"Godfather" Could only be one role, and that is the godfather
wiki.keyword.outlineList: A list of outlines that defines what roles are in the game. It allows player to know how many of a certain role could be in the game. Each player gets a role generated randomly from one outline. When roles are generated from the outline list, each role is equally likely to generate from a single outline.
wiki.keyword.priority: This is the order that roles go in. Each ability is excuted in a order that depends on priority. Go to the priority page for more information.
wiki.entry.article.404.title: Page not found
wiki.entry.article.404.text: If you see this, please report this as a bug, along with what steps you took to arrive to this page.
wiki.entry.article.how_to_play.title: How to play
wiki.entry.article.how_to_play.text:
This guide is for typical game modes. To learn how to play other game modes, ask the host.

The game has two major teams, Town and Mafia. The goal is to be the last team remaining alive. The town wants to find out who the mafia is and vote them out. The mafia wants to deceive the town to try to stay hidden so they don't get voted out.

Every role has abilities. Abilities are how players collect information, kill players, and prevent kills, among other things.

In order to find out who the mafia is, townies need to share information they have in order to deduce who is lying about their role. This is done with the use of Wills, which are records of the abilities you have used and information you have gathered. Wills are posted in the chat and graveyard when the player dies. Here is an example of a typical will that a Sheriff would have.

> Sheriff
Night 1: Deodat Lawson - Innocent
Night 2: Samuel Parris - Suspicious

When the Sheriff posts this will in chat, they provide evidence to other players that on the second night, they found Samuel Parris as Suspicious, implying that Samuel Parris is a mafia member. If the town believes the Sheriff, they will likely vote them out.

For a mafia member to pretend to be a town role, they need to write a fake will to pretend to be a town role. _IF A PLAYER DOES NOT HAVE A WILL, THEY ARE LIKELY A MAFIA MEMBER_ who doesn't know how to write a fake will, and they should be directed to this page.

In order to write a fake will, it is important to know how the town role that is being faked works. Above is an example of a Sheriff will; To fake claim more roles, it is important to look at the encyclopedia article for that role and learn about the role to write a fake will for it.
wiki.entry.article.phases_and_timeline.t:
The game is always in a phase. Phases run in this order:

### Night
This is when most roles use their abilities. Chat is closed at night so players can not communicate with each other. However, some roles can communicate with others at night, for example, the medium can talk to the dead, and mafia can talk with each other.

### Morning
Players see who died last night, their final will, and any death notes that were placed on the body. 

### Discussion
Players discuss information they have to try to find out who the evil players are, or if they‚Äôre evil themselves, pretend to. Evil players will often try to throw out red herrings or pin the blame on someone else.

### Voting
Players vote to put a player on trial, but this doesn‚Äôt always mean that player is going to be killed. The players need a majority of the votes in order to put someone onto trial. If the voting phase ends before a majority is reached, it goes directly to night after. There can be a maximum of three trials during each day.

### Testimony
This phase comes after voting only if a player was voted onto trial. The player on trial gives their testimony while everyone else stays quiet. Usually the player on trial will claim a role and post their will here.

If you have been voted for a trial, don‚Äôt give up. Even if you‚Äôre evil, you can lie your way out of getting hanged.### Judgment
This phase comes after testimony. Everyone votes either innocent, or guilty. If there are more guilty votes than innocent votes, the player on trial is killed. Players can also choose to abstain. The judgment period is usually how the town gets evil players killed.

### Evening
A brief period before night. If someone was voted guilty today, this is usually where they get to say their final words.

When there are three or less players alive, each phase is half as long as it usually is.
wiki.entry.article.priority.title: Priority
wiki.entry.article.priority.text:
Abilities are used in a specific order called priority order. If two players have abilities that go on the same priority, the player with the lower player number will go first. It is recommended that you read a roles encyclopedia page before this page. Some abilities go before night starts. Attacking someone doesn't kill them untill the end of the night. Here are all the priorities and the abilities that happen in them.

**Before Night (Not a priority)**

- Jailor chooses who to jail
- Death kills everyone
- Create Visits
  - All visits are decided by targeting the correct number of players, then roles execute their abilities using visits during their priority to affect other players

**1: Top Priority**

- Amnesiac (Convert)
- Doomsayer (Kill)
- Executioner (Suicide)
- Jester (Haunt)
- Veteran (Decide to Alert)
- Vigilante (Suicide)

**2: Transporter**

- Transporter (Swap Visits)

**3: Control**

- Witch (Possess)

**4: Necromancy**

- Retributionist (Possess/Change Visits)
- Necromancer (Possess/Change Visits)

**5: Roleblock**

- Consort (Roleblock)
- Escort (Roleblock)
- Jailor (Invisible Roleblock)

**6: Deception**

- Framer (Frame)
- Blackmailer (Silence)
- Janitor (Clean)
- Consort (Send Fake Messages)
- Arsonist (Douse)

**7: Bodyguard**

- Bodyguard (Change visits)

**8: Heal**

- Bodyguard (Defend themselves)
- Crusader (Defend target)
- Doctor (Defend)
- Veteran (Defend themselves)

**9: Kill**

- Arsonist (Ignite)
- Bodyguard (Attack attacker)
- Crusader (Attack Visitor)
- Godfather (Attack or Make Backup Attack)
- Jailor (Attack)
- Mafioso (Attack)
- Veteran (Rampage)
- Vigilante (Attack)
- Werewolf (Rampage and attacks)

**10: Investigative**

- Arsonist (Find who is doused)
- Bodyguard (Find if protected)
- Consigliere (Investigate)
- Crusader (Find if protected)
- Death (Collect souls)
- Doctor (Find if protected)
- Janitor (Find role and will)
- Lookout (Investigate)
- Psychic (Investigate)
- Seer (Investigate)
- Sheriff (Investigate)
- Spy (Find who the Mafia Visits)
- Tracker (Investigate)
- Werewolf (Track players scent)

**11: Spy Bug**

- Spy (Bug)

**12: Steal Messages**

- Witch (Get target messages)
- Necromancer (Get target messages)
- Retributionist (Get target messages)

**13: Convert**

- Vampire (Convert)
wiki.entry.article.all_language.title: All text
wiki.entry.role:
# \0
### Guide \1 ### Abilities \2 ### Attributes \3 ### Extra \4
### Role Limit: \5 ### Defense: \6
### Keywords \7
wiki.entry.role.noBasics: There is no basics section written for this page.
wiki.entry.role.noAbilities: There is no abilities section written for this page.
wiki.entry.role.noAttributes: There is no attributes section written for this page.
wiki.entry.role.noExtra: There is no extras section written for this page.
wiki.entry.role.jailor.title: Jailor
wiki.entry.role.jailor.guide: During the day, choose one player to jail each night. You can talk to your prisoner during the night, and they wont know who you are. You should interrogate your prisoner to find out what their role is, and if you think they are evil, you can choose to execute them. You can execute up to three times, but if you kill a townie, you can not jail anyone anymore.
wiki.entry.role.jailor.abilities:
* Choose one player to jail during the day
* Visit your prisoner to execute them
wiki.entry.role.jailor.attributes:
* You may anonymously talk with your prisoner at night
* If you execute a town member, you forfeit the ability to jail prisoners, and loose all execution uses
* Jailed players are immune to most abilities being used on them
* Jailed players can't target
* Other players will know if the player they visit is jailed
wiki.entry.role.jailor.extra:
* The Jailor cant choose to execute on night one
* If you execute a townie, or run out of executions, you can not target anymore
* You will invisibly roleblock the player you jailed
wiki.entry.role.mayor.title: Mayor
wiki.entry.role.mayor.guide: Reveal during the day to make your vote count as three votes. After you reveal everyone will know that you are the Mayor. You can also write a journal and choose to make it public, if it is public it will posted at the start of every day. You should write down what everyone claims in your journal so you can remind town of what is true.
wiki.entry.role.mayor.abilities:
- Reveal during the day to triple your voting power, showing everyone that you are the Mayor
- If your journal is public, it will be posted to chat at the start of every morning
wiki.entry.role.mayor.attributes:
- You get three times the voting power during both voting and judgment after you reveal
- Your journal will be posted anonymously, nobody will know who wrote it before you reveal
wiki.entry.role.mayor.extra:
- If you are converted to a different role, players will still see that you are the mayor
- Revealing does not increase the number of votes required to put someone on trial
- If there is more than one Mayor with a public journal, their journals will be posted in player order
wiki.entry.role.transporter.title: Transporter
wiki.entry.role.transporter.guide: You can choose two people at night. If somebody else tries to visit the first player, they will instead visit the second player, and vice versa. Typically you want to transport innocent players with suspicious ones to divert a potential attack onto the suspicious player.
wiki.entry.role.transporter.abilities: - Visit two players to transport them
wiki.entry.role.transporter.attributes:
- All visits to the first player will instead be to the second player
- All visits to the second player will instead be to the first player
- The players you visit will get a message saying that they were transported
wiki.entry.role.transporter.extra:
- Some abilities can not be transported, but most can. For example: You can't stop a jester from haunting their target using a transport
- A transporters visits can not be changed by another transporter
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.title: Sheriff
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.guide: Choose players to find if they're innocent or suspicious. If they're suspicious, they're _likely_ evil. You should tell the town the information you get daily. Targeting suspicious looking players often gives the most important information.
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.abilities: - Visit a player and find out if they're innocent or suspicious
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.attributes:
- Townies show up as innocent
- Non townies show up as suspicious
wiki.entry.role.sheriff.extra:
- A suspicious aura will make the player you visit look suspicious
- An innocent aura will make the player you visit look innocent
wiki.entry.role.lookout.title: Lookout
wiki.entry.role.lookout.guide: Target players to find out who else visited them. You should tell the town the information you get daily. Targeting players who you think will die will allow you to see who killed them, giving important information.
wiki.entry.role.lookout.abilities: - Visit a player to find all other visitors to them
wiki.entry.role.lookout.attributes: - You can not see your own visit
wiki.entry.role.lookout.extra:
- You can not see astral visits
- A framer can change your results
wiki.entry.role.spy.title: Spy
wiki.entry.role.spy.guide: Choose a player to find what happened to them. You will passively learn who the mafia visited. You should tell the town the information you get daily. If the mafia can not visit themselves, then everyone who the mafia visits must not be mafia.
wiki.entry.role.spy.abilities:
* Visit a player to find out what happened to them
* You will know who the mafia visited
wiki.entry.role.spy.attributes: * Your bug will catch when your target sees a message saying they are silenced, roleblocked, protected, possessed, or transported
wiki.entry.role.spy.extra:
* The mafia visits can not be fooled, they are always accurate
* You can not see astral visits
wiki.entry.role.tracker.title: Tracker
wiki.entry.role.tracker.guide: Choose a player each night to find who they chose. You should tell the town the information you get daily. You should try to choose people who you think are lying.
wiki.entry.role.tracker.abilities: - Visit a player to find who they visit
wiki.entry.role.tracker.extra:
- A Framer can make players appear to have visited someone they didn't visit
- You can't see Astral visits
wiki.entry.role.seer.title: Seer
wiki.entry.role.seer.guide: Choose two people each night to learn if they are friends or enemies. You should tell the town the information you get daily. You should try to choose one person who you are certain is innocent, and one person who you think is evil.
wiki.entry.role.seer.abilities: - Visit two players to find if they're friends or enemies
wiki.entry.role.seer.attributes:
- If two players are friends they can win together
- If two players are enemies they can't win together
wiki.entry.role.seer.extra: - Players with suspicious aura will appear to be enemies with everyone- Players with innocent aura will appear to be friends with everyone
wiki.entry.role.psychic.title: Psychic
wiki.entry.role.psychic.guide:
The psychic will receive a vision every night.

On odd nights, the vision will show two players and say that at least one of them is a townie.
    
On even nights, the vision will show three players and say that at least one of them is not a townie. 
    
You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.entry.role.psychic.abilities:
- Get an evil vision on odd nights
- Get a good vision on even nights
wiki.entry.role.psychic.attributes:
- Evil visions show three players, at least one of them is not a townie
- Good visions show two players, at least one of them is a townie
wiki.entry.role.psychic.extra:
- If there aren't enough evil or good players to have a vision, it will fail
- You can not be in your own vision
- You still get visions after you are dead
- You wont try to Visit the players in your vision
- Players with suspicious aura can come up as the evil player in your evil vision
- Players with innocent aura can come up as the good player in your good vision
wiki.entry.role.doctor.title: Doctor
wiki.entry.role.doctor.guide: Choose someone to protect each night. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You can only target yourself once.
wiki.entry.role.doctor.abilities: - Visit a player to grant them powerful defense for that night
wiki.entry.role.doctor.attributes: - If you heal yourself, you lose the ability to target yourself
wiki.entry.role.doctor.extra:
- You will be told if the player you visit is attacked
- The play you visit will be told that they were protected if they were attacked
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.title: Bodyguard
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.guide: Choose someone to protect each night. If the player you protect is attacked, you will be attacked instead, but you kill the attacker. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You can only target yourself once.
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.abilities:
- If someone visits the player you protect with an attacking visit, they will be redirected into visiting and attacking you
- If you redirect a visit into yourself, you will attack the attacker back with a powerful attack
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.attributes:
- If you protect yourself, you will lose the ability to target yourself, you will not redirect any attacks, instead you will gain powerful defense.
- If you redirect multiple attackers, you will attack all of them with a powerful attack
wiki.entry.role.bodyguard.extra:
- You will be told if the player you visit is attacked
- The play you visit will be told that they were protected if they were attacked
wiki.entry.role.crusader.title: Crusader
wiki.entry.role.crusader.guide: Choose someone to protect each night and kill a random visitor to them. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You could easily accidentally kill townies, so you should try to make sure no other townies visit the player you protect.
wiki.entry.role.crusader.abilities:
- Visit a player to grant them powerful defense for that night
- Kill a random other visitor to the player you protect
wiki.entry.role.crusader.attributes:
- If any non town members visited the player you visited, the visitor you attack will be one of them
- If you are the only visitor to the player you protect, you won't attack anyone
wiki.entry.role.crusader.extra:
- You can not target yourself
- You will be told if the player you visit is attacked
- The play you visit will be told that they were protected if they were attacked
- You won't visit the players you attack
wiki.entry.role.escort.title: Escort
wiki.entry.role.escort.guide: Choose a player to stop them from using their ability. You should try to choose evil players
wiki.entry.role.escort.abilities: - Visit a player to Roleblock them
wiki.entry.role.escort.attributes:
- You can not be Roleblocked
- The player you visit will know if they were Roleblocked, even if they are immune to being Roleblocked
wiki.entry.role.escort.extra: - When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.entry.role.medium.title: Medium
wiki.entry.role.medium.guide: You have no active ability, but you can talk with the dead at night. After you die, you can choose to speak with a living player two times, this is called a haunt. You can also speak with other mediums at night. You should try to find out any information from other players and tell the town, and tell the town what dead players think about the game.
wiki.entry.role.medium.abilities:
- At night, you can read messages from dead chat
- You can message dead chat anonymously
- After you are dead, choose a living player during the day to haunt and speak with them that night. You can perform two haunts. All dead mediums take part in a haunt.
wiki.entry.role.medium.attributes:
- You can read dead messages from jail, but you can't send messages to the dead while in jail.
- You can read messages from other Mediums
- Your messages will appear to be sent by "Medium"
wiki.entry.role.medium.extra:
- A Haunt puts the haunted living player in the haunt chat with all dead mediums
- If multiple dead mediums haunt multiple living players at the same time then all the dead mediums and haunted players will be together in a haunt chat
- Every medium can do two haunts, so two mediums can do four haunts
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.title: Retributionist
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.guide: Choose a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player/players of your choosing. You can only choose to possess dead townies. You can't possess the same player twice.
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.abilities:
- Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
- Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.attribute:
- The first player you visit is told that they were possessed, or immune to possession
- You can see all night information messages that the player you possess gets
- You can't target a dead player who you have already possessed, if you do not end up possessing that player, you can target them the again
- You can only target dead players who's gravestones show a town role
wiki.entry.role.retributionist.extra:
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
- You can force players you possess visit any living player
- All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.title: Vigilante
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.guide: Choose a player to attack them, if you kill them and they are a townie, you will commit suicide on the following night (and probably cause town to lose). You have only three bullets and you can not shoot on night one.
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.abilities:
- Visit a player to basic attack them and use up a bullet
- If you kill a townie you will commit suicide on the following night
- You have three bullets
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.attributes:
- You can not target players on day one
- When you have zero bullets left you can not target people
- If you are going to commit suicide you can not target people
- You have a basic attack
wiki.entry.role.vigilante.extra:
- If you visit a player while you have zero bullets left you will not attack them
- If you visit a player while you are about to commit suicide then you will not attack them
- If your attack overpowers a townies defense and they die, you will commit suicide on the following night
- If you visit a player on day one you will not attack them
wiki.entry.role.veteran.title: Veteran
wiki.entry.role.veteran.guide: Choose yourself to go on Alert, attacking everyone who visits you. You can go on Alert three times. You should try to bait evils into attacking you on nights you alert to kill them.
wiki.entry.role.veteran.abilities:
- Visit yourself to go on alert, attacking everyone who visits you
- While on alert, you have basic defense
wiki.entry.role.veteran.attributes:
- You have a powerful attack
- You have three alerts
- You will know if you attacked a visitor
- Players who visit you while on alert will know that they were attacked by a veteran
wiki.entry.role.veteran.extra:
- If you have no alerts left you can not target yourself
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
wiki.entry.role.deputy.title: Deputy
wiki.entry.role.deputy.guide: Once per game, choose a player during the day, attacking them. If you kill them, you will be revealed to the town as the Deputy. If you kill a townsperson, you will instantly commit suicide.
wiki.entry.role.deputy.abilities: - Use your special ability to shoot a player during discussion or voting once per game
wiki.entry.role.deputy.attributes: - If their defense overpowers your attack, they will be told that they were attacked, but you won't be revealed as deputy
wiki.entry.role.godfather.title: Godfather
wiki.entry.role.godfather.guide: Choose a player to kill each night. Choose a backup to kill when you are roleblocked or jailed. You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.entry.role.godfather.abilities:
- Visit a player to attack them
- If you are roleblocked or jailed, your backup will attack the first player they visit
- Choose another living mafia member to be your backup at any time
wiki.entry.role.godfather.attributes:
- You have a basic attack
- You always have an innocent aura
wiki.entry.role.godfather.extra:
- If the mafia has no Godfather or Mafioso, then a random mafia member will be converted to a godfather
- If the Godfather dies, their backup will become the Godfather
- You can not target other mafia members
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.title: Mafioso
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.guide: Target players to kill them. You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.abilities: - Visit a player to attack them
wiki.entry.role.mafioso.extra: - You can't target other mafia members
wiki.entry.role.consort.title: Consort
wiki.entry.role.consort.guide: Choose a player to roleblock and hypnotise them. If you roleblock them, they wont be able to use their ability that night. They will be sent whatever messages you select. You can also choose to not roleblock them, and only send them messages.
wiki.entry.role.consort.abilities: - Visit a player to roleblock or hypnotise them
wiki.entry.role.consort.attributes:
- You can not be Roleblocked
- You can choose not to roleblock them, and only send them messages, but you will always send at least one message
wiki.entry.role.consort.extra:
- You can't target other mafia members
- When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.title: Blackmailer
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.guide: Choose a player to silence them. They can't speak during the next day, and they can't vote during the next day. You should choose talkative players who might speak out against a mafia member
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.abilities: - Visit a player to silence them
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.attributes:
- Silenced players can not vote during the voting phase
- Silenced players can not talk in chat or out loud during the entire next day
wiki.entry.role.blackmailer.extra:
- The silenced player will no longer be silenced at the start of the next night
- You cannot target other mafia members
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.title: Consigliere
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.guide: Choose a player to learn their role, who they visited, and who visited them. You should communicate the information you get to the rest of the mafia.
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.abilities:
- Visit a player to
    - Learn their role
    - Learn who visited them
    - Learn who they visited
- All whispers can be read regardless of whether or not they were sent to you
wiki.entry.role.consigliere.extra: - You can't target other mafia members
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.title: Necromancer
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.guide: Choose a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player/players of your choosing. You can't possess the same player twice.
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.abilities:
- Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
- Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.attributes:
- The first player you visit is told that they were possessed, or immune to possession
- You can see all night information messages that the player you possess gets
- You can't target a dead player who you have already possessed, if you do not end up possessing that player, you can target them the again
wiki.entry.role.necromancer.extra:
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
- You can force players you possess visit any living player
- All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.entry.role.witch.title: Witch
wiki.entry.role.witch.guide: Choose a player to possess and force them to visit a player/players of your choosing.
wiki.entry.role.witch.abilities:
- Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
- Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.entry.role.witch.attributes:
- The first player you visit is told that they were possessed, or immune to possession
- You can see all night information messages that the player you possess gets
wiki.entry.role.witch.extra:
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
- You can't target other mafia members for your first target, but you can target living player for your second and third targets
- All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.entry.role.janitor.title: Janitor
wiki.entry.role.janitor.guide: Choose a player to clean them. Cleaning a player on the night they daie erases their role and will from their grave. You only can use your ability three times. You should usually choose the same player as the godfather, becuase they will probably die.
wiki.entry.role.janitor.abilities:
- Visit a player on the night they die to clean their grave
- If you clean a player on the night they die, their role and will does not appear in the graveyard.
- You will know the role and will of the player you cleaned.
wiki.entry.role.janitor.attributes:
- You have three uses of your ability
- If you visit a player and attempt to clean them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
- If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
- If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
wiki.entry.role.janitor.extra: - You can't target other mafia members
wiki.entry.role.forger.title: Forger
wiki.entry.role.forger.guide: Choose a player to forge their role and will. Forging a player on the night they daie edits their role and will in their grave. You only can use your ability two times. You should usually choose the same player as the godfather, becuase they will probably die.
wiki.entry.role.forger.abilities:
- Visit a player on the night they die to forge their grave
- If you forge a player on the night they die, their role and will will appear to be what you choose in the graveyard.
- You will know the original role and will of the player you forged.
wiki.entry.role.forger.attributes:
- You have two uses of your ability
- If you visit a player and attempt to forge them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
- If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
- If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
wiki.entry.role.forger.extra:
- You can't target other mafia members
* If you choose no role, their grave will show what their original role is
* If you left their will completly blank, it will look to be the same as their original will
wiki.entry.role.framer.title: Framer
wiki.entry.role.framer.guide: Choose two players to frame the first one, making it seem like they killed the second one according to investigative roles. Try to choose players who already look a little suspicious so investigative roles might choose them.
wiki.entry.role.framer.abilities:
- Visit one player to give them a suspicious aura
- Visit two players
  - The first player you visit will have a suspicious aura for the night
  - The first player will appear to visit the second player you visited
wiki.entry.role.framer.attributes: - Your first visit will have a suspicious aura. So they will look suspicious to a Sheriff, they can appear as the evil player to a Psychic, and they will be enemies with everyone to a Seer.
wiki.entry.role.framer.extra: - You can't choose other mafia members for your first target, but you can choose any player for your second target, including dead players and other mafia members
wiki.entry.role.jester.title: Jester
wiki.entry.role.jester.guide: Get lynched during the day to win. If you win, you can attack any living player who voted you guilty or abstained. Try to look suspicious without making it obvious that you are the Jester.
wiki.entry.role.jester.abilities:
- On the night after you were just lynched, deal an unstoppable attack to the first player you visit
- - Gain basic defense on night one
wiki.entry.role.jester.attributes:
- You have an innocent aura
- If you target nobody on the night after you are lynched. You will visit a random living player who did not vote you innocent, and deal an unstoppable attack to them.
wiki.entry.role.jester.extra: - Your attack is unstoppable and top priority, So the Transporter, Witch, or Necromancer can not force you to kill someone else.
wiki.entry.role.executioner.title: Executioner
wiki.entry.role.executioner.guide: Get your target lynched to win. If you win, you commit suicide at the start of the next night. You should try to claim something that makes people think your target is suspicious.
wiki.entry.role.executioner.attributes:
* After you win you will commit suicide with an unstoppable attack
* Your target will always be a townie, but never a Mayor, Jailor, Deputy, Veteran, or Transporter
* You have an innocent aura
* You have basic defense
wiki.entry.role.executioner.extra:
* Get your target lynched to win
* If your target dies by something other than lynching, you will be converted to a jester immedietly
* If there are no valid targets in the game when you become the executioner, you will be converted to a jester
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.title: Doomsayer
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.guide: Guess the role of three different players to win. If you guess the role of three different living players correctly, you kill all three of them, and commit suicide. You can not guess town investigative roles. You should listen to what people claim and try to push for more people to claim roles.
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.abilities: * Guess the role of three different living players in one night, killing them and winning
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.attributes:
* When you win, you will commit suicide using an unstoppable attack
* You have to guess the exact role of townies, but you only need to guess the faction of all other roles
* You can not try to guess town investigative roles
* If there are not enough players left for you to guess and win, you will convert to a jester
* You do not visit when you kill
* Your attack is unstoppable
wiki.entry.role.doomsayer.extra:
* Your three guesses must be three different players
* You will still win, even if the players you guessed correctly don't die
wiki.entry.role.politician.title: Politician
wiki.entry.role.politician.guide: * If the town wins, you win instead. So try to help to the town to win while staying alive.
wiki.entry.role.politician.abilities:
* When town would normally win, if you are still alive, you win instead
* When you win, you kill every townie, and all politicians commit suicide
wiki.entry.role.politician.attributes:
* You win with other polititians
* Your have an unstoppable attack
wiki.entry.role.politician.extra:
* Suicide is an unstoppable attack
* When you first become this role, if there are no townies alive, you become a jester
wiki.entry.role.arsonist.title: Arsonist
wiki.entry.role.arsonist.guide: Choose a player each night to douse them in gasoline. Target yourself to ignite, killing every player who is doused. You will know who is doused. Dont try to douse people you think the mafia will kill, because then you waste your night dousing someone who is going to die anyway.
wiki.entry.role.arsonist.abilities:
- Visit a player to douse them
- Visit yourself to deal an unstoppable attack to all doused players
- If a player visits you, you will douse them
wiki.entry.role.arsonist.attributes:
- You can't be doused
- You will know who is doused
- If you are in jail, you will douse the jailor, and you will still douse players who visit you
wiki.entry.role.arsonist.extra: - If you are roleblocked you will still douse visitors
wiki.entry.role.werewolf.title: Werewolf
wiki.entry.role.werewolf.guide: On full moon nights, choose someone to kill them and rampage, killing everyone who visits them. On non full moon nights, choose someone to gain their scent and passively gain the scent of everyone who visits you. If you have someones scent, you will know who they visit every night for the rest of the game. Try to attack players who will get visited by alot of people in order to kill more players. Claiming that you are the Tracker could be easy because you know who people visit each night.
wiki.entry.role.werewolf.abilities:
* On full moon nights visit a player to attack them and rampage them
* On non full moon nights visit a player gain their scent, you also gain the scent of every player that visits you on non full moon nights
* If you visit nobody on a full moon night, you rampage yourself, but you wont attack yourself unless you visit yourself
wiki.entry.role.werewolf.attributes:
* You have a powerfull attack
* If you are jailed then you will attack all Jailors who did not execute you
* You will know who you have the scent of
* You still track the scent of players after you die
* On non full moon nights you have an innocent aura
wiki.entry.role.werewolf.extra:
* You will not rampage the jailor while in jail
* You will still attack or gain the scent of visits to you when you are jailed
* You will still track the players you have the scent of while jailed
* You dont attack or gain the scent of astral visitors
* A Roleblock has no effect on you besides erasing your visits, if you are roleblocked, it is as if you visited nobody
wiki.entry.role.death.title: Death
wiki.entry.role.death.guide: Guess what player will die during night by targeting them, If you guess correctly you will collect a soul, you will also collect a soul passively each night. Once you have six souls, everyone will be told at the start of the day, if you survive that day, you will attack everyone and win the game at the start of night.
wiki.entry.role.death.abilities:
* Visit a player on the night they die to collect a soul
* Once you've collected six souls, everyone is notified, and at the start of the next night, you kill everyone, and win
* Passively gain a soul each night
wiki.entry.role.death.attributes: * You gain invincible defense once you have six souls
wiki.entry.role.death.extra: * You will still passively gain souls in jail
wiki.entry.role.amnesiac.title: Amnesiac
wiki.entry.role.amnesiac.guide: Choose a role to become on the next night. You can choose a certain outline to and get a random role if you want, or get a specific role.
wiki.entry.role.amnesiac.abilities: * Choose an outline to become a role from that outline at night
wiki.entry.role.amnesiac.attributes: * Roleblocking or jail doesn't effect you
wiki.entry.role.amnesiac.extra:
* You can choose an outline like "Neutral Killing", and you will get a random neutral killing role, or choose an outline like "Jailor" and confirm that you get the jailor
* If you choose a role that was excluded from the game you will stay as the Amnesiac
wiki.entry.role.vampire.title: Vampire
wiki.entry.role.vampir.guide: Choose a player to conver them to a vampire, only one of the vampires can actually choose to convert a player. You can only convert a player if you did not the night before.
wiki.entry.role.vampire.abilities: * Visit a player to convert them to a vampire
wiki.entry.role.vampire.attributes:
* Only the newest vampire can choose to bite
* Vampires can not bite on the night immediately following a night that they successfully converted another vampire
* If there are four or more vampires, they can not choose to bite someone
wiki.entry.role.vampire.extra:
* You can not convert a player with defense
* You can only target if the number of living vampires is less than or equal to the half of the number of living players
